title: Algorithms Category Quiz
description: Mixed quiz across Big O, searching, traversal, sorting, and hashing.

questions.question: Which complexity is usually best among these for large n?
questions.explanation: Logarithmic growth is slower than linear and superlinear growth.

questions.question: Binary search requires data to be:
questions.explanation: Ordering is required to discard half the range safely.

questions.question: For shortest path in unweighted graphs, choose:
questions.explanation: BFS discovers nodes by minimum number of edges.

questions.question: Merge sort time complexity is:
questions.explanation: Split levels are logarithmic with linear merge work per level.

questions.question: The one-pass Two Sum solution is centered around:
questions.explanation: It checks complements in a hash map during one array scan.

questions.question: A recursion checklist should include:
options: Base case and progress toward it
questions.explanation: Termination and progress are mandatory for correct recursion.

questions.question: Space complexity of iterative binary search is commonly:
questions.explanation: Only a few index variables are needed.

questions.question: Which pairing is correct?
options: BFS with stack, DFS with queue
BFS with queue, DFS with stack/recursion
questions.explanation: Queue enforces level order; stack/recursion enforces depth order.
